titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Exotics to go [electronic resource] : fast food for outreach.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Exotics to go [electronic resource] : fast food for outreach.

odd.head: Publication, Distribution, Etc.
odd.p: [Duluth, Minn. : Great Lakes Sea Grant Network], 2002.

odd.head: Varying Form of Title
odd.p: Title on container: Exotics to go : presentations & publications to prevent the spread of aquatic nuisance species

odd.head: Varying Form of Title
odd.p: Presentations and publications to prevent the spread of aquatic nuisance species

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: [P]roduced by the Illinois-Indiana and Minnesota Sea Grant programs on behalf of the Great Lakes sea Grant Network"--Container.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: "[D]eveloped by the Great Lakes Sea Grant Network especially for lake associations, natural resource agency staff, and extension educators"--Container.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: "Funding for this project was provided by a grant from the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to the National Sea Grant College Program through an appropriation by Congress based on the National Invasive Species Act of 1996"--Container.

archdesc.scopecontent: Contains 7 Powerpoint presentations that also are available in QuickTime format that address zebra mussel impacts and control. Identification and control of nonindigenous aquatic pests are included, replete with directories of regional contacts for aquatic nuisance species.
